parameters.definition: Cost of an advertisement on z-tube
Number of viewers attracted by an advertisement on z-tube
Cost of an advertisement on soorchle
Number of viewers attracted by an advertisement on soorchle
Cost of an advertisement on wassa
Number of viewers attracted by an advertisement on wassa
Maximum number of advertisements allowed on soorchle
Maximum proportion of the total number of advertisements that should occur on wassa
Minimum proportion of the total number of advertisements that should occur on z-tube

description: A company is deciding where to promote their product. Some options include z-tube, soorchle engine, and wassa advertisements. The cost for each option and the number of viewers they each attract is given. On z-tube, each ad costs \$\param{CostZtube} and attracts \param{ViewersZtube} viewers. On soorchle, each ad costs \$\param{CostSoorchle} and attracts \param{ViewersSoorchle} viewers. On wassa, each ad costs \$\param{CostWassa} and attracts \param{ViewersWassa} viewers. Soorchle limits the number of advertisements from a single company to \param{MaxAdsSoorchle}. Moreover, in order to balance the advertising among the three types of media, at most \param{MaxPropWassa} of the total number of advertisements should occur on wassa. And at least \param{MinPropZtube} should occur on z-tube. The weekly advertising budget is \$\param{Budget}. How many advertisements should be run in each of the three types of media to maximize the total audience?
